intro: Simira goudotii, commonly known as the African blackwood, is a small evergreen tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its valuable timber, it is also considered an important species for ecological and economic reasons.
